info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:49PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall will impact portions of west central Lewis and Clark County through 445 PM MDT... At 346 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered thunderstorms clustered just north of Lincoln. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...The rainfall may produce rapid runoff or debris flow in steep terrain. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Lewis and Clark County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
